intro: Euphrasia × christii, commonly known as the hybrid eyebright, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, often hairy stems and clusters of small, yellowish or greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors or along stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its flowers are usually borne in dense inflorescences. Euphrasia × christii is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
